messages: 63216e0fe85863244b2e81f99b43d200 (03:32): what is the tag to have a little black circle for listing item please

77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (03:52): And maybe quirks mode, or one of IE's "other" quirks.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (03:52): Which one?  There are many possible DOCTYPEs.
9407c15adfef07bccc43f9c240a95d7d (03:52): I don't have a doctype declaration
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (03:52): Oh-- that would put IE in quirks mode..
9407c15adfef07bccc43f9c240a95d7d (03:53): when did we have to start doing this
63216e0fe85863244b2e81f99b43d200 (03:53): is this a webpage editor free on windows
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (03:53): nulled: It's always been in the specs.
9407c15adfef07bccc43f9c240a95d7d (03:53): i do my html by hand

9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (03:54): I can find them if you need
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (03:54): True...  I'll look it up at some point.

77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (03:57): It's really hard to recommend anything without looking at the code..

9407c15adfef07bccc43f9c240a95d7d (03:57): i might be able to tweak this
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (03:58): It'll save a lot of pain later..
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (03:58): nulled: chances are you should read this, too: http://hotdesign.com/seybold/
9407c15adfef07bccc43f9c240a95d7d (04:02): what HTML editor do you guys use?
9407c15adfef07bccc43f9c240a95d7d (04:02): okay wow, I get it, linux user
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:03): Not necessarily..  Vim runs on almost anything.
9407c15adfef07bccc43f9c240a95d7d (04:03): riesio: that webpage is stupid, it's preference that I use tables
63216e0fe85863244b2e81f99b43d200 (04:03): what is xml? all the new thing in the xhttp protocol?
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:04): And incidentally, the shortcut for that link..  is `table stupid
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:04): And tables are stupid for layout.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:04): Because they're meant for tabular data.
9407c15adfef07bccc43f9c240a95d7d (04:05): just because CSS is more flexible doesn't mean tables can't be used also
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:06): The reason that tables shouldn't be used for non-tabular data...  is because that's not using them for their purpose.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:06): Not to mention all the other reasons in the link.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:06): (If you read it through at all)
9407c15adfef07bccc43f9c240a95d7d (04:06): that guy just doesn't like tables
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:06): It has nothing to do with preference.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:06): It has to do with semantic markup.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:06): And accessibility, search engine visibility, flexibility, etc.

9407c15adfef07bccc43f9c240a95d7d (04:07): eitherway, I am going to continue to use tables, because the only time I started having problems is when they started making shit more complecated and adding all this junk we don't need
724e11b464aae809dab7312a026bcf88 (04:08): But then, I use XHTML 1 strict ..
724e11b464aae809dab7312a026bcf88 (04:08): Did I say tables? I meant frames ..
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:08): Which is why I'm sticking with HTML for now.
724e11b464aae809dab7312a026bcf88 (04:08): That's fine, I don't support IE.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:09): Well, the classic hard-headed table user.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:09): So defensive when faced with reason and logic...
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:09): They are..  the bane of the web!!
724e11b464aae809dab7312a026bcf88 (04:09): Tables are only really needed when they're needed ..
724e11b464aae809dab7312a026bcf88 (04:10): When they're not, use something else.

b4043b5dbead4669ffb1b8b03787ee44 (04:39): is there a way to disable them being made automatically?
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:45): dawkirst: Look at :he backup or something.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:45): (Sorry, I'm not a Vim expert yet)
724e11b464aae809dab7312a026bcf88 (04:51): I bet you use KDE too ..
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:53): Or..  I don't care at all.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:53): The only graphical things that I use are IM, browser, and music player.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (04:53): So the desktop environment doesn't matter much to me.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (05:07): Gnome is somewhat simple and elegant.
724e11b464aae809dab7312a026bcf88 (05:07): I used to use Vim, then I started using emacs and found I worked a lot better with it. I guess it all comes down to personal preference.
724e11b464aae809dab7312a026bcf88 (05:07): Yes, that is why I like gnome.
724e11b464aae809dab7312a026bcf88 (05:08): Also, I use Gtk. So having a desktop environment that uses Gtk means I don't need to have any other crappy toolkits lying around.
724e11b464aae809dab7312a026bcf88 (05:09): Though, I did use Tk for a little while whilst learning Tcl.
